tk.tkExtra module¶

tkExtra adds on to existing Tkinter classes and functions By doing so, it is easier to accomplish common tasks, such as centering a Tk() or Toplevel() instance

class tk.tkExtra.Calltip(widget, **options)[source]¶

Bases: tk.tkExtra.Tooltip

Maintained for backwards-compatibility

class tk.tkExtra.Hyperlink(master=None, text='', **options)[source]¶

Bases: Tkinter.Label

Uses a Label widget as a hyperlink Supported options: link, command, underline, justify, activeColor, activatedColor, inactiveColor, bindings

click()[source]¶
class tk.tkExtra.Infobox(widget=None, **options)[source]¶

Creates an information box, based on a widget Supported options: title, text, fg, bg, font, events, delay, widget, offsetX, offsetY, width, height, cleanup

show(event)[source]¶

Show the infobox

class tk.tkExtra.InputWindow(master=None, prompt='', **options)[source]¶

Bases: tk.tkBase.BaseCustomWindow

Creates an Entry Window with a prompt and space to enter input Supported options: title, font, binding, type, to, from, defaultValue, width, buttonFont, exitCommand = quitCommand, cleanup, okText = goText, buttonWidth, center, resize, offsetX, offsetY

Returns the selected value

Bases: tk.tkBase.BaseCustomWindow

Bases: tk.tkBase.BaseCustomWindow

Creates a window with checkboxes representing multiple options Supported options: title, fg, bg, font, binding, buttonFont, maxRow, exitCommand = quitCommand, cleanup, okText = goText, center, resize, offsetX, offsetY

class tk.tkExtra.OptionsWindow(master=None, prompt='', *choices, **options)[source]¶

Bases: tk.tkBase.BaseCustomWindow

Creates an Options window with a question, with Radiobuttons representing each option Supported options: title, font, optionSize, optionFont, defaultOption, binding, maxRow, indicatoron, exitCommand = quitCommand, cleanup, okText = goText, center, resize, offsetX, offsetY

class tk.tkExtra.Prompt(master=None, prompt='', *choices, **options)[source]¶

Bases: tk.tkBase.BaseCustomWindow

Creates a basic prompt with a question, with Buttons representing each option Supported options: title, font, buttonSize, buttonFont, exitCommand = quitCommand, cleanup, defaultButton, defaultBinding, maxRow, center, resize, offsetX, offsetY

class tk.tkExtra.Tooltip(widget, **options)[source]¶

Creates a window similar to IDLE’s tool-tips Supported options: widget, text, fg, bg, font, delay, event = binding, events = bindings, leave, offsetX, offset, cleanup
